author: David Schuyler
title: Marcus Theatres unveiling upgrades at Madison’s Point Cinema this weekend
text: Enlarge The Marcus Palace Cinema in Sun Prairie opened five months ago. Marcus Theatres Corp. will begin unveiling a new amenity at its Marcus Point Cinema location on Madison’s west side as the Milwaukee movie theater firm continues to bolster its offerings to compete with other entertainment options. Marcus said its DreamLounger recliner seating will be offered at some of the 15 screens at the Point Cinema beginning this weekend with roll-out to all screens to be complete by the end of November. Marcus said in a press release that the DreamLounger seating offered at the company’s new Palace Cinema in Sun Prairie was the top amenity attracting audiences to the theater, which debuted five months ago. Marcus identified customers' preferences in a survey conducted in the wake of the Palace Cinema's opening. Enlarge The Marcus Palace Cinema in Sun Prairie opened five months ago. “Marcus Theatres continues to add comforts and conveniences to locations based on what our customers will appreciate most,” Rolando Rodriguez , president and chief executive officer of Marcus Theatres, said this week. Marcus Theatres is a division of Milwaukee-based Marcus Corp. (NYSE: MCS). In recent years, Marcus Theatres added an UltraScreen DLX and new food and beverage options to the Point Cinema, including a Take Five Lounge and Zaffiro’s Express. Movie theater companies have been busy adding amenities to their cinemas to compete with home entertainment options that include wide-screen TVs and stereo surround-sound. The AMC Fitchburg 18 cinema in nearby Fitchburg has begun adding recliner seating to its theaters as part of renovations that began last month, the Capital Times reported.
